intro: Acer pseudoplatanus var. purpureum, commonly known as the purple maple, is a variant of the common maple tree native to Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive purple-tinted leaves, which turn vibrant red in the fall. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a broad, spreading crown. Its bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and parks due to its striking foliage.
